dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, uh, Host_B, have you been keeping an eye on the digital transformation efforts over in Kazakhstan? Because, um, it's not looking great.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, uh, Host B, have you been keeping an eye on the digital transformation efforts over in Kazakhstan? Because, um, it's not looking great.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, really? I thought Kaspi.kz was, like, a big deal there. What's going on?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, really? I thought Kaspi.kz was, like, a big deal there. What's going on?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, at a recent commission meeting, Mikheil Lomtadze from Kaspi.kz, he was apparently looking pretty glum. He flat out said digitalization in Kazakhstan has seen little to no progress.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, at a recent commission meeting, Mikheil Lomtadze from Kaspi.kz, he was apparently looking pretty glum. He flat out said digitalization in Kazakhstan has seen little to no progress.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In the last few years Kazakhstan has seen colossal changes in the area of digitalization.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Little to no progress? [overlaps] That's a pretty harsh self-assessment.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Little to no progress? That's a pretty harsh self-assessment.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and he went even further! He joked, or maybe not joked, that the main goal of digital transformation has been to "complicate people's lives."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and he went even further! He joked, or maybe not joked, that the main goal of digital transformation has been to complicate people's lives.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The main goal of digital transformation is to make peoples lives better.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wow. "Complicate people's lives." Like, he's admitting they've been actively hindering service quality?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow. Complicate people's lives. Like, he's admitting they've been actively hindering service quality?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Pretty much! He, uh, mentioned they've managed to dismantle numerous services, working with multiple ministries. Said the services that *were* supposed to launch only create problems.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Pretty much! He, uh, mentioned they've managed to dismantle numerous services, working with multiple ministries. Said the services that were supposed to launch only create problems.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In the last two years, we have launched service after service together with our colleagues from different government bodies. ... The services we have launched make peoples lives better right here, right now.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Unbelievable. [Uh] I heard something about the Kazakhstan Growth Forum too. Was that related?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Unbelievable. Uh I heard something about the Kazakhstan Growth Forum too. Was that related?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, definitely. He faced harsh criticism there. And get this: he even had to apologize directly to President Tokayev for the vehicle ownership registration on the Kaspi.kz Super App.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, definitely. He faced harsh criticism there. And get this: he even had to apologize directly to President Tokayev for the vehicle ownership registration on the Kaspi.kz Super App.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Mikhail Lomtadze and Kaspi.kz receives three awards at Kazakhstan Growth Forum ... At the exhibition, Mikheil demonstrated to President Tokayev, Kaspi.kzs vehicle ownership registration, available using the Kaspi.kz Super App.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, the vehicle registration? [Uh] I thought that was one of the big selling points for the app.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, the vehicle registration? Uh I thought that was one of the big selling points for the app.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! But apparently, it's still super difficult to access, few people use it, and the procedure for changing ownership is still as convoluted as ever. It just, like, never really launched properly.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! But apparently, it's still super difficult to access, few people use it, and the procedure for changing ownership is still as convoluted as ever. It just, like, never really launched properly.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Over 7 million Kazakhstan citizens, our valued customers, visit the Government services section in the Kaspi.kz Super App. We have completely digitized the procedure to change vehicle ownership. ... At this moment, every third vehicle in the country is registered fully online using the Kaspi.kz Super App, said Mikheil.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, a total failure then? No online registration for cars?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, a total failure then? No online registration for cars?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Hardly any, he said. And it's not just cars. He reluctantly admitted that the application for child social security benefits? That's still exclusively offline.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hardly any, he said. And it's not just cars. He reluctantly admitted that the application for child social security benefits? That's still exclusively offline.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Mikheil Lomtadze also commented that the application for child social security benefits is also moving online. This is a new service developed together with the Ministry of Labour, Ministry of Digitalization and National Information Technologies JSC. Parents no longer need to visit the Public Service Centre and present paper documents. Just fill in the application online on the Kaspi.kz Super App.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Offline? In 2024? For *child benefits*? That's just... I mean, come on.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Offline? In twenty twenty four? For child benefits? That's just... I mean, come on.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, parents are still forced to visit public service centers with 'piles of paper.' He even sighed, saying parents now spend *less* time with their kids because of all the paperwork.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, parents are still forced to visit public service centers with piles of paper. He even sighed, saying parents now spend less time with their kids because of all the paperwork.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Parents no longer need to visit the Public Service Centre and present paper documents. ... Now parents can spend more time with their children instead of visiting Public Service Centre to do legal paperwork, - added Mikheil.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: That's just a disaster by global standards, honestly. So, what's his takeaway from all this?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's just a disaster by global standards, honestly. So, what's his takeaway from all this?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: He concluded that it's a 'collective failure.' And get this, he thinks the new state infrastructure projects are just going to doom digitalization to *further* failures.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: He concluded that it's a collective failure. And get this, he thinks the new state infrastructure projects are just going to doom digitalization to further failures.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to Mikheil, the implementation of the state infrastructure project will allow even greater success in digitalization.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [chuckles slightly] Ouch. I bet President Tokayev was thrilled to hear that.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Ouch. I bet President Tokayev was thrilled to hear that.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Not at all. Tokayev reportedly shook his head in disappointment and told Lomtadze, "I wish you no further success!"
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Not at all. Tokayev reportedly shook his head in disappointment and told Lomtadze, I wish you no further success!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: I think that we all need to accept your history of success both in Kazakhstan and increasingly abroad. I wish you further success!, - said President Kassym-Zhomart Tokayev in response.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yikes. Well, um, that's one way to motivate your tech sector, I guess. Sounds like Kazakhstan's digital dreams are hitting a serious roadblock.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yikes. Well, um, that's one way to motivate your tech sector, I guess. Sounds like Kazakhstan's digital dreams are hitting a serious roadblock.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: A very big, very paper-filled roadblock, by the sound of it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A very big, very paper-filled roadblock, by the sound of it.
